defs.docs: High performance XML reader/writer.

attributes.value: / - `Reader`: a low level xml pull-reader where buffer allocation/clearing is left to user
/ - `Writer`: a xml writer. Can be nested with readers if you want to transform xmls
/ // The `Reader` does not implement `Iterator` because it outputs borrowed data (`Cow`s)
/     // for triggering namespaced events, use this instead:
/         // unescape and decode the text event using the reader encoding
/         Ok(Event::Eof) => break, // exits the loop when reaching end of file
/         Err(e) => panic!("Error at position {}: {:?}", reader.buffer_position(), e),
/         _ => (), // There are several other `Event`s we do not consider here
/     // if we don't keep a borrow elsewhere, we can clear the buffer to keep memory usage low
/             // crates a new element ... alternatively we could reuse `e` by calling
/             // copy existing attributes, adds a new my-key="some value" attribute
/             // writes the event to the writer
/         Err(e) => panic!("Error at position {}: {:?}", reader.buffer_position(), e),
/ let expected = r#"<my_elem k1="v1" k2="v2" my-key="some value"><child>text</child></my_elem>"#;
/ quick-xml supports 2 additional features, non activated by default:

defs.name: Error
defs.value:
pub enum Error {
    Io(::std::io::Error),
    Utf8(::std::str::Utf8Error),
    UnexpectedEof(String),
    EndEventMismatch {
        expected: String,
        found: String,
    },
    UnexpectedToken(String),
    UnexpectedBang,
    TextNotFound,
    XmlDeclWithoutVersion(Option<String>),
    NameWithQuote(usize),
    NoEqAfterName(usize),
    UnquotedValue(usize),
    DuplicatedAttribute(usize, usize),
    EscapeError(::escape::EscapeError),
}
defs.docs: The error type used by this crate.

defs.name: EscapeError
defs.value:
pub enum EscapeError {
    EntityWithNull(::std::ops::Range<usize>),
    UnrecognizedSymbol(::std::ops::Range<usize>,
                       ::std::result::Result<String,
                                             ::std::string::FromUtf8Error>),
    UnterminatedEntity(::std::ops::Range<usize>),
    TooLongHexadecimal,
    InvalidHexadecimal(char),
    TooLongDecimal,
    InvalidDecimal(char),
}

/ The XML specification requires attribute keys in the same element to be unique. This check
/ can be disabled to improve performance slightly.

defs.docs: A struct representing a key/value XML attribute.

/ Field `value` stores raw bytes, possibly containing escape-sequences. Most users will likely
/ want to access the value using one of the [`unescaped_value`] and [`unescape_and_decode_value`]

defs.name: unescaped_value
defs.docs: Returns the unescaped value.

attributes.value: / This is normally the value you are interested in. Escape sequences such as `>` are
/ replaced with their unescaped equivalents such as `>`.
/ This will allocate if the value contains any escape sequences.

defs.name: unescaped_value_with_custom_entities
defs.docs: Returns the unescaped value, using custom entities.

attributes.value: / Returns the unescaped value, using custom entities.
/ This is normally the value you are interested in. Escape sequences such as `>` are
/ replaced with their unescaped equivalents such as `>`.
/ Additional entities can be provided in `custom_entities`.
/ This will allocate if the value contains any escape sequences.
/ The keys and values of `custom_entities`, if any, must be valid UTF-8.

attributes.value: / This allocates a `String` in all cases. For performance reasons it might be a better idea to
/ * [`Reader::decode()`], as it only allocates when the decoding can't be performed otherwise.
/ * [`unescaped_value()`], as it doesn't allocate when no escape sequences are used.

defs.value: pub fn new(&[u8], Option<&[u8]>, Option<&[u8]>) -> BytesDecl
defs.docs:
Constructs a new `XmlDecl` from the (mandatory) _version_ (should be `1.0` or `1.1`),
 the optional _encoding_ (e.g., `UTF-8`) and the optional _standalone_ (`yes` or `no`)
 attribute.

attributes.value: / Constructs a new `XmlDecl` from the (mandatory) _version_ (should be `1.0` or `1.1`),
/ the optional _encoding_ (e.g., `UTF-8`) and the optional _standalone_ (`yes` or `no`)
/ Does not escape any of its inputs. Always uses double quotes to wrap the attribute values.
/ The caller is responsible for escaping attribute values. Shouldn't usually be relevant since
/ the double quote character is not allowed in any of the attribute values.

defs.name: Event
defs.value:
pub enum Event<'a> {
    Start(BytesStart),
    End(BytesEnd),
    Empty(BytesStart),
    Text(BytesText),
    Comment(BytesText),
    CData(BytesText),
    Decl(BytesDecl),
    PI(BytesText),
    DocType(BytesText),
    Eof,
}
defs.docs: Event emitted by [`Reader::read_event`].

defs.docs: Changes whether empty elements should be split into an `Open` and a `Close` event.

attributes.value: / Changes whether empty elements should be split into an `Open` and a `Close` event.
/ When set to `true`, all [`Empty`] events produced by a self-closing tag like `<tag/>` are
/ expanded into a [`Start`] event followed by a [`End`] event. When set to `false` (the
/ default), those tags are represented by an [`Empty`] event instead.

defs.name: trim_markup_names_in_closing_tags
defs.value: pub fn trim_markup_names_in_closing_tags(&mut Self, bool) -> &mut Reader<B>
defs.docs:
Changes whether trailing whitespaces after the markup name are trimmed in closing tags
 `</a >`.

attributes.value: / Changes whether trailing whitespaces after the markup name are trimmed in closing tags
/ If true the emitted [`End`] event is stripped of trailing whitespace after the markup name.
/ Note that if set to `false` and `check_end_names` is true the comparison of markup names is
/ going to fail erronously if a closing tag contains trailing whitespaces.

defs.name: check_end_names
defs.value: pub fn check_end_names(&mut Self, bool) -> &mut Reader<B>
defs.docs: Changes whether mismatched closing tag names should be detected.

attributes.value: / Changes whether mismatched closing tag names should be detected.
/ When set to `false`, it won't check if a closing tag matches the corresponding opening tag.
/ If the XML is known to be sane (already processed, etc.) this saves extra time.
/ Note that the emitted [`End`] event will not be modified if this is disabled, ie. it will
/ contain the data of the mismatched end tag.

defs.name: check_comments
defs.value: pub fn check_comments(&mut Self, bool) -> &mut Reader<B>
defs.docs: Changes whether comments should be validated.

attributes.value: / Changes whether comments should be validated.
/ When set to `true`, every [`Comment`] event will be checked for not containing `--`, which
/ is not allowed in XML comments. Most of the time we don't want comments at all so we don't
/ really care about comment correctness, thus the default value is `false` to improve

defs.value: pub fn read_event<'a, 'b>(&'a mut Self, &'b mut Vec<u8>) -> Result<Event>
defs.docs: Reads the next `Event`.

attributes.value: / This is the main entry point for reading XML `Event`s.
/ `Event`s borrow `buf` and can be converted to own their data if needed (uses `Cow`
/ Having the possibility to control the internal buffers gives you some additional benefits
/ - Reduce the number of allocations by reusing the same buffer. For constrained systems,
/   you can call `buf.clear()` once you are done with processing the event (typically at the
/ - Reserve the buffer length if you know the file size (using `Vec::with_capacity`).
/         Err(e) => panic!("Error at position {}: {:?}", reader.buffer_position(), e),

defs.name: event_namespace
defs.docs: Resolves a potentially qualified **event name** into (namespace name, local name).

attributes.value: / Resolves a potentially qualified **event name** into (namespace name, local name).
/ *Qualified* attribute names have the form `prefix:local-name` where the`prefix` is defined
/ on any containing XML element via `xmlns:prefix="the:namespace:uri"`. The namespace prefix
/ can be defined on the same element as the attribute in question.

defs.name: attribute_namespace
defs.docs: Resolves a potentially qualified **attribute name** into (namespace name, local name).

attributes.value: / Resolves a potentially qualified **attribute name** into (namespace name, local name).
/ *Qualified* attribute names have the form `prefix:local-name` where the`prefix` is defined
/ on any containing XML element via `xmlns:prefix="the:namespace:uri"`. The namespace prefix
/ can be defined on the same element as the attribute in question.
/ *Unqualified* attribute names do *not* inherit the current *default namespace*.

attributes.value: / Manually write a newline and indentation at the proper level.
/ This can be used when the heuristic to line break and indent after any [Event] apart
/ from [Text] fails such as when a [Start] occurs directly after [Text].
/ This method will do nothing if `Writer` was not constructed with `new_with_indent`.
